pages.text: $(9)Armor$() is a measure of how resistant you are to physical damage.$(p)Usually provided by armor items, and shields.$(p)How much damage you take is a function of the incoming damage and your armor.

The first component of the formula is the $(br)A-value, equal to $(9)10 + (damage - 20) / 2$(), with a minimum value of $(9)10$().$(p)You then reduce damage equal to $(br)$(9)A / (A + armor)$().$(p)The aforementioned formula is not the one used by Vanilla Minecraft, as Apotheosis replaces it.
For vanilla armor and damage values, you will find yourself taking slightly less damage.$(p)For high armor and damage values, armor will be significantly less effective.

The goal of this change is to reduce invulnerabilty at high levels, and make $(9)Protection$() and $(9)Resistance$() more impactful.$(p)It also makes fights where both parties are heavily armored significantly more active.
